column1: Menasha () is a city in Calumet and Winnebago counties in the U.S. state of Wisconsin. The population was 17
column6: 209 were in Calumet County. The city is located mostly in Winnebago County; only a small portion is in the Town of Harrison in Calumet County. Doty Island is located partially in Menasha. The city's name comes from the Winnebago word meaning "thorn" or "island". In the Menominee language
column8: meaning "little island". Menasha is home to the Barlow Planetarium and Weis Earth Science Museum
column9: both housed at the University of Wisconsin-Fox Valley.

column1: The city of Menasha has a city council-mayor system of government. There are eight districts in the city
column2: each represented by an aldermen. The council meets weekly with the mayor

column1: The Wisconsin Evangelical Lutheran Synod (WELS) has two churches in Menasha: Bethel Lutheran Church and Mount Calvary Lutheran Church.Architect Harry Weese designed Menasha's St Thomas' Episcopal Church.
